eu.stratosphere.nephele.template

Class AbstractFileInputTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.stratosphere.nephele.template.AbstractInvokable
      • eu.stratosphere.nephele.template.AbstractInputTask<FileInputSplit>
        • eu.stratosphere.nephele.template.AbstractFileInputTask
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectoryReader, FileLineReader

    public abstract class AbstractFileInputTask
extends AbstractInputTask<FileInputSplit>
    Specialized subtype of AbstractInputTask for tasks which are supposed to generate input from a file. In addition to AbstractInputTask this class includes a method to query file splits which should be read during the task's execution.
    Author:
    warneke

      • computeInputSplits

        public FileInputSplit[] computeInputSplits(int minNumSplits)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method computes the different splits of the input that can be processed in parallel. It needs to be implemented by classes that describe input tasks.

        Note that this method does not return the input splits for the task instance only, but it computes all splits for all parallel instances. Those computed splits are then assigned to the individual task instances by the Job Manager. To obtain the input splits for the current task instance, use the #getTaskInputSplits() method.

        Specified by:
        computeInputSplits in class AbstractInputTask<FileInputSplit>
        Parameters:
        minNumSplits - The minimum number of splits to create. This is a hint by the system how many splits should be generated at least (typically because there are that many parallel task instances), but it is no hard constraint
        Returns:
        The input splits for the input to be processed by all instances of this input task
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getInputSplitType

        public java.lang.Class<FileInputSplit> getInputSplitType()
        Returns the type of input splits that is generated by this input task.
